Reviews.Title: “Customer comes 1st.”
Reviews.Author: Leticia M
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego visiting my father in law, which had become ill & I shared our reason for visit with staff. Three weeks later my father in law passed away. Mr. Patel remembered us and was compassinate and eager to accomodate us up to the very last need of an additional roll away bed. We were located close to freeways and many varieties of places to eat. The breakfast provided by Ramada was fresh and satisfied our needs with fresh fruit and variety of fruit juices, as well as fresh coffee each morning. Wish we had more of these caring, down to earth type of places in other places we visit. All was clean and plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Kenny J
Reviews.Content: Check in time was 1:00 pm. I showed up at 9:00 am. They found me a room, even though I just said I was inquiring what time check in was. Very clean. TV and stations were fine. This may sound funny, but loved the scent of the soap and shampoo. Made me hungry, lol. For the price of the stay, don't think you can beat it. Also, a complimentary continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: t s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the great ratings. Can't see what everyone's raving about. I found it to be reasonably clean. Not super spiffy clean but acceptable. Rooms are nothing great. Location is not fantastic. Price was reasonable. All in all, an average place for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Annie L
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms, one for 4 nights and one for 5 nights. - We were there for our son's graduation from MCRD and we wanted a hotel that was close to the recruiting center and not out of sight in price. - And we got it all and more! - The staff was great and very helpful in every way. It was an easy, quick drive from the hotel to MCRD and also to the airport - The staff helped us find wonderful restaurants right in the area. - The rooms were clean and good sized and the bed was soooo comfortable! - The wireless internet worked wonderful. And, their coffee was almost as good as what we brew at home!! - I can't think of anything to complain about - Thank you for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to $tay & $ave!!!”
Reviews.Author: QS4MsCherry
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I worked with this hotel many of times. Each time I booked my clients into the hotel they were pleased with their accomadations and thrilled with their savings! The hotel has an ideal location, great staff and unbeatable customer service. I would recommed this hotel to anyone who is coming into the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Out !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bartsimpson2012
Reviews.Content: dont know about other review but , for your safety stay away . the hotel is not in nice area ,on the main road in very noise location we stay 3 night and barley sleep becouse of the noise and law level of guest . the room is not clean and very stinky they use bug spray. last night was nightmare one of the guest mass out and no one did anything .

Reviews.Title: “Our two night stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: Patrice A
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched the internet to get a reasonably priced hotel for my family that was near to Sea World and San Diego Zoo and I was very skeptical when I saw the reviews online for this hotel and I even sent them an email saying that I hope that I do not see any insects and that I do not get a smelly room as I had read from other travellers, and the Manager, Mr Patel called me to assure me that they are under new management and that I will not be disappointed. And he was right. The room was clean and did not smell musty. The sheets and towels were all up to standards and the A/C, coffee maker and TV worked great. And there were alot of fast food restaurants within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin186220
Reviews.Content: This Motel is a good location for Sea World, Old Town and the Beach. Clean and tidy with very friendly staff. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The room and employes were great”
Reviews.Author: jackmitchell24
Reviews.Content: The room exceded my expetitions. Very good value for the money. Lisa Perez at the desk was very helpful. She recomened restaurants, and even printed out a map to help us find it. The room was clean, bed comfortable, employes friendly and very helpful. A positive experience

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: SharonD46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight (8) days in April, 2011. The owner/manager, Mr. Patel, and his staff were so very helpful and courteous. They could answer all our questions about attractions, restaurants, and sightseeing and offered coupons and discounts. Mr. Patel took over the Ramada in February, 2011 and has made many improvements. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the staff kept the food replenished during the entire breakfast from 6:30 AM until 9:30 AM. So if you came late you still had fresh fruit (bananas, oranges, apples,etc.) and a good assortment of danishes, muffins, bagels, cereal, etc. You could take the food to your room or eat in the lobby or upstairs on an open balcony. Each room has a refrigerator and a microwave. The bathrooms have been remodeled and the showers have a functional shower head that varies pressure and spray. The rooms are kept very clean by a cheerful cleaning staff. Coffee is available in the lobby at anytime and it was good. However, the room also had a coffee maker that made one cup at a time and the quality of this coffee was outstanding. Usually the coffee in most motel rooms is almost undrinkable. We had a king size bed that was very comfortable with nice clean bedding. The room was not huge but very adequate with a table and two chairs, a computer desk with ergonomic chair, and a comfortable, overstuffed armed chair. The open closet was about 6 feet long and easily held our clothes as well as our luggage on the floor. The TV was good and had many channels including HBO. The location is perfect. It is close to the airport, Sea World, Old Town, Balboa Park, downtown, and all the expressways. We can highly recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Your first choice hotel for Sea World visiting”
Reviews.Author: klost
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Sea World, San Diego. It took only 10 minutes from the hotel. The room is clean and quite big. We experienced a very nice hospitalities from the hotel's general manager, Mr. Patel. If we had a chance to visit San Diego again, Ramada Sea World would be our first chice.

Reviews.Title: “its called Limited,.. because its very limited. wouldn't stay every again.”
Reviews.Author: wolflover5
Reviews.Content: Search Reviews Recent Reviews10 Reviews Sort by: Date Filter by: Location Category 885 W Harbor Dr San Diego, CA 92101 (619) 239-3968 San Diego Pier Cafe Category: Seafood 2/15/2011 the ony thing good about this resturant is its view. the service was horrible and the food was horrible.. DON'T be fooled that the website said its a 4 star resturant. i went to the cafe for my 21st birthday. it was a big deal. the pictures show it to be beautiful and made my jaw drop of the view but its not worth it!! first we got there wasn't really busy mabe like 5 tables were filled. it took them 15 mins JUST to ask if we wanted water or not. then it took 35 mins before we got our food. i ordered the shimp and scallops fettichini. the noodles were hard. and i'm not one to send my plates back but i did and ordered a steak. and because it my husband was almost done with his steak i almost didn't want to even order another plate but i did. i got the steak because my husband said it was good. they said sorry for the mess up plate but give them a few mins to get my steak for me. i order it rare i didn't think it would take that long. it took them 35 more mins!!!!! are you serious?? the menus didn't have very much on it. the drinks were limited i had to order something that wasn't even on the menu. every time we wanted to ask our server we had to flag him down.. he never came to the table to just ask hows the food? we even had to call another watress to get our server. he did give me a few SMALL cup of clam chowder and did give me a piece of cake for my birthday we will NEVER GO BACK ever.. and i don't recomend it all.. dont be fooled by the pictures.. please trying to save from a huge trouble!! Edit Remove Send To A Friend Link to this Review 3747 Midway Drive San Diego, CA 92110 (619) 225-1295 Ramada Limited Seaworld Category: Hotels Neighborhood: Midway 2/15/2011 just listen to the name "Limited" there was no pool. the rooms were alright.. and mind you, we got the best room possible..the room had no microwave, is does have a fridge and a coffee machine i didn't use. the tv sucked. there was like 20 channels and like 10 of them were in spanish. the color of it was horrible. it came with a desk and two bedside tables. the bathroom was clean. the room was alright to stay at but would NEVER do it again. the room didn't smell like other people had said. and other people said that people would stick pizza coupons in the door at like 8 or 9 pm and it didn't happen to us. the breakfast was horrible!! there was only a few muffins and cinnamon rolls,toast and a few choices of juice. the hotel i have to say was in a great location!! seaworld was literally 2 mins the zoo was less then 15 mins. the belmont was like 5 mins. there wasn't that many good restuarants around the hotel. and it sucks beacuse there was no microwave so we could atleast reheat food but we couldn't.. the front desk wasn't really friendly. it was alright.. and we traveled from the SF all the way down to San Diego doing research but when we asked him what can we eat or go and see and he knew NOTHING. when you work in a place like a hotel where people come to visit you should atleast know whats around your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will never see us again”
Reviews.Author: Domes_Wifey
Reviews.Content: Wow, never again will my husband and my family stay in this hotel. We arrived on a early like 1 am saturday morning and right when were unloading our bags out to go up to our rooms, we see a cockroach running from under the coach around us. Disgusting. the best part is the concierge or clerk (whatever you want to call him) just watched the roach run around our feet and did nothing. We were so disgusted and freaked to even stay at this point. However seeing how my reservations were non-refundable we just stayed but were disgusted the whole time. We did not even sleep under the covers the first night. The room is so small it does not even have a closet. The hotel looks like a old building with a bit of fresh paint and new furniture. Our room door was installed improperly as their was a big gap of space allowing air and light to come through enough to light the room from the hallway. We never tried the breakfast as my in-laws and myself were still disgusted from the roach we saw up on arrival. Last but not least was the gnats that seemed to multiply on our last night in our room. I am not too sure on how they stay in business and call themselves a Hotel. i have stayed at the Ramada branch before and I am ashamed to even think they are included. I think I will stay with the Hilton or Sheraton from now on.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: hrefa
Reviews.Content: We went to the Seaworld so we booked this room because very near of the Seaworld. The room was normal, internet was OK. The only problem we had on the reception, the check in was approximatelly 1 hour (in late night!!!), the lady first had a long call with one client, after that She did not found our redervation, (calls again...) we told we want to pay by cash, so She want deposit from us, OK. We went to our room, after just a few minutes we received a call from her, that we have to pay more something, so back to the reception, etc etc, always something. It was a very long check in...

Reviews.Title: “Gone Down Hill!!”
Reviews.Author: Roni67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel about 4 years ago because it was close to Sea World. I read the reviews before I booked but we enjoyed ourselves the last time we stayed so I booked anyway. BIG MISTAKE!! As I was checking in, some guy asked the front desk clerk if the mailman had come yet. She said yes and he replied that he always missed him on Saturdays. That exchange let me know that they have people LIVING in the hotel. It made me leery the more I thought about it because there are certain people who HAVE to live in hotel rooms. Had I had my computer, I would have checked the sex offender registry. My 10 year old daughter went to use the bathroom and found some many legged dead bug in the toilet. When she flushed, the tank started spewing water on the floor! I went to the front desk clerk, (I tried to call but she didn't answer the phone),and she said that they didn't have anyone to fix it. Another person staying at the motel suggested that I use a big trash bag and tie it around the tank to catch the water. Fortunately it worked, although I should not have had to do that myself. I had to use some towels to soak up the water and when I asked for more to shower with, they didn't have enough! The water wet the filthy carpet so the room stank the entire weekend. (They had no other rooms or I would have moved.) Later that night, my 10 year old found a cup filled with a condom box that had been left in the room from a previous occupancy and the cleaning staff had not discarded it. I kicked it under the bed because I didn't want to touch it (it's probably still there!) Needless to say, I was very disappointed in this hotel. I will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel- Seconded”
Reviews.Author: traveler1668
Reviews.Content: A big roach on the shower curtain was the weclome committee as my mother-in-law stepped into the bathroom. Wife and I had developed rash after using the shower water. Hot water tank or pipe usted ? Adult super store and an Arby that has outside restrooms that required a coin to open the door. wife was afraid tio go out after seeing the other guest hangingout outside their room. A typical "rent-by-hour" enviroment with street peoples infront. Room has a mildew odor even the Ramada logo cant cover up. They charged the rate with a Ramada Limited logo and because of the proximity to Sea world. we used Hotwire to book the room, We for sure did not get what we paid for !!! Ramada and Hotwire should follow advise to inspect the property and pull the plug. Multiple negative star rating if there is one !!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TemRoy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel/motel several times and I've never had a problem. The room has always been clean and the staff has always been helpful and considerate. No bugs, mold or funky smell. I like the location because it's close to Sea World and its close proximatey to fast food places. On a couple of occasions I've walked across the street after dark to Wendy's for dinner and have never felt unsafe. Yes, the doors slam loudly if you allow them to slam. Yes, the parking spaces are scarily narrow. And the Sea World fireworks are loud (first time I heard them I thought people kept slamming doors). When the price is within my budget, it's my first choice location.

Reviews.Title: “eww, big mistake”
Reviews.Author: angel90008
Reviews.Content: omg. My family & I live in L.A. and my dad decided the nite b4 that he wanted to go to SeaWorld and take my four year old counsin. Since it was the last minute and a big holiday weekend, everything was booked up. I am always the one to find the hotel room for the best value and check the reviews. I was so frustrated after seeing all the nice hotels close by were booked up, and it was really late, and I was sleep, so I gave up. My mom took over the search and found that the Ramada Limited Seaworld which was five minutes away from seaworld was not booked up. she asked if i wanted to check it out and read the reviews, but I was too tired to care. I regret not reading the reviews on tripadvisor like I normally do. As soon we got close to the parking lot, i felt like i was entering into a cheap motel. This was the type of lodging where you enter your room from outside. The rooms were small. The toilet was GROSS. It looked like there was a night stand or something missing. Shouldn't there be something on each side of the bed. I had to move a chair so I could have some where to put the stuff (laptop, book, ipod, etc.) i wanted next to side of my bed. The walls must have been really thin, because we could hear everything our LOUD DRUNK neighbors were doing, saying, and listening too. I was so uncomfortable the whole time. This place has no pool or exercise room. There was free continental breakfast. The breakfast consisted, of pastries, waffles (I think you were suppose to put them in the toaster), bagles, muffins, two types of cereal, milk, and juice. The room was definetly not worth what we were charged. The positive things- FREE WIRELESS INTERNENT AND A REFIGERATIOR IN THE ROOM.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada "LIMITED" is exactly what it means!!!”
Reviews.Author: CampAdvisor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights, we chose this location because it was close to Seaworld and it offered a "continental breakfast" but it wasn't even worth these two things. Keep your shoes on! Floors were dirty, left feet black & sticking to the floor. Cigarette burns on small fridge, all though its a 100% non-smoking hotel? Had to have key reset after returning for the evening. Shower head unit came out of wall, large bug crawled out. Requested maintenance to fix but never did. Shower head was VERY low, I'm 5'6 and had to seriously crouch to wash. Room smelled stale constantly. Hair dryer blew out our electricity, we had to move to another room since maintenance went home. Pillow had large green stain. Doors slamming all night, thin walls to hear EVERYTHING! Parking spaces too small, found dings on the doors. Fast food all around, along with adult stores and strip clubs. Not safe to go walking out at night. Staff unfriendly and unhelpful, especially when they're watching tv or on their cell phones. Breakfast was juice, bagels, bread, waffles, 1 toaster + lots of guests...do the math. Seaworld shoots off fireworks about 950pm and you WILL hear them. The A/C unit is very old and very loud. We weren't expecting a 5 star hotel, but after staying in so many hotels we know there should be some kind of standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place to come home to”
Reviews.Author: stro1
Reviews.Content: The room did smell a little "funky" when we arrived. They're were damp towels in the fridge. (not sure what that was about.) I booked this place on expedia and the photos looked nothing like the room. I dont know what hotel those photos were of ?? The carpet was dirty, there were cigerette burns in the bathroom area, the walls were extremly thin, you hear doors from the other rooms slaming all night, the traffic noise from the road and the airport was loud. NOT PEACFUL to say the least. I think I was in the same room the other reviewer was in, because the tub had this big strange bubble on the bottom and was really uneven. also had a strange plaster job in spots.I would never actually bathe in there! Also, it was Memorial day weekend so the parking was VERY limited. Our neighbors were woke by the staff at 3am and asked to move they're 2 motorcycles into one spot, instead of the 2 they were using, because another guest needed a parking spot. (more doors slaming) I would never stay at this place again. We actually left a day early with no refund :-( It just wasn't a nice place to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: BalwynCalling
Reviews.Content: Ticks: free internet terminal in lobby with free printing, free parking, ok rooms, location with shops and restaurants and Seaworld (could almost walk there if you wanted to save $12 in parking). Plenty of good value food outlets nearby especially the food court behind the motel reception. Breakfast was a bit limited, (ended up buying my own box of cereal as I do not like Raisin Bran or Cheerios) but something is better than nothing. Also got a view of Seaworld fireworks at night. Negatives - room key had to be reset 3 times, and had another guest accessed our room while I was getting changed (a bit weird as the access card should not of allowed this).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheJourneyer
Reviews.Content: I requested a king-sized bed, upper floor, non-smoking. We stayed at this hotel from 1/4/08 to 1/5/08. Hotel: The hotel is conveniently located near Sea World San Diego. There are also several restaurants within walking distance, one right across the street. Room: Our room was basic, clean, quiet and functional. The bathroom is larger than normal hotel bathrooms and functional for our needs. We were located on the upper floor in the corner, it was also off-season and raining pretty heavily which may account for why it was so quiet. Here's something funny... when we stayed there, I was just coming down with a head cold, so I was using three pillows to prop myself up during the night to try to prevent the congestion from moving into my ears. When my husband got up to go pee in the morning, I realized that of the three pillows I'd primarily been using, it was the lumpiest, hardest, most uncomfortable one. The other two were soft and fluffy, totally dreamy, and I'd been using the lumpy pillow. So I got an hour of fluffy comfort. Go figure. Moral of the story -- check all your pillows, you might have a good one and not know it! Amenities: The WiFi seemed to work okay, some websites were apparently blocked, for what reason I don't know. Thank goodness for vtunnel.com. The other odd thing is, the parking spots were really narrow. If you drive a Miata, you might be okay, but everyone else was having a really tough time trying to fit. We left the hotel at 9:45 AM and, unfortunately, missed the continental breakfast by 15 minutes. Guess we can't snooze if we want to eat! Staff: The front desk staff were professional and helpful. Overall: The room was comfortable and functional. The location was perfect for our needs. The hotel staff were professional and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, scam scam scam!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roygbiv34
Reviews.Content: The place was ok, it had blood on one set of the sheets the first night. Then after we checked out they tried to scam us by charging 200 dollars for the room smelling like smoke. It did not. This is a total lie that I am in the middle of trying to get to the bottom of. Stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “no way!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE got there at night - so we couldnt see all those spider web next to the bed... street noise was auful!!!!!!!!!! bathroom-hair on the floor from the previous guests, i think, shower - not clean, carpet - not clean, no good!!!!!!!!!!!!! Never again, not for this price, for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gross, very gross”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only give this two dots rather than one because I didn't see any bugs. Thougth to be honest, I wouldn't have been surprised if I did see them. This place is not a nice hotel. Think motel and go down a notch. The location is very close to sea world and major highways, but it is also in a bad area. I would not feel safe walking around outside at night. We stayed here because it was one of the few reasonably priced hotels on hotels.com. Also it was rated 2 out of 4 stars on hotel, which I thought would be a good rating. Obviously I was wrong. I will never trust or use hotels again. Of course had I know about trip advisor before my vacation I wouldn't have stayed there in the first place. The bathroom was extremely small and there was a bubble at the bottom of the tub so it was uneven. Had I had shower slippers I would have worn them. No one in our party slept on the sheets, we all brought our own blankets. There was a funky smell in the room. It was just gross and not worth the money. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that nothing was stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AHAMMONS
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and it had free breakfast and free shampoo, and free maid service. For $46 PER NIGHT???? In San Diego??? No complaints here. Actually, I booked the room last year sometime and all I could get for this price was a smoking room. I called a week before our trip and asked to be switched to a non-smoking room for no extra charge and the lady said that it would be taken care of. However, when we got there, we were still in the smoking room and there were not any non-smoking rooms available so we did have to suffer with that AWFUL smell, and there was a nasty cigarette burn on the side of the bathtub - but we aired out the room, sprayed lysol and lit a candle - by the time we left you wouldn't have known it was a smoking room. That was my only complaint. I would definitely stay there again! We had a great vacation -

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ramada because my brother graduated from the military depot nearby. Uh Rah-Marines! Before deciding on staying at this hotel we almost stayed at the Good Nite Inn nearby until we read the reports . This place was maybe a smidge above that. I felt uncomfortable the whole night......not comfortable enough to go in the shower without shower shoes. There was a smell in the room that seemed someone tried to heavily mask with room spray. We got a room with two queen beds upstairs and it seemed that the t.v. was in a weird positon to even watch .......not inbetween the beds as it should be but nearer to the one closest to the bathroom. In order to comfortably watch t.v. one had to pile in on one bed. The ceiling had spots on it that looked like it came from bad plumbing from above and anytime anyway left or entered a room you could hear it. When I finally climbed in bed I noticed dirt on the sheet and some unidentifiable stain. Needless to say I used a shirt that I brought as a pillow case and covered the stain with kleenex. I said my prayers went to sleep with my socks on. I won't be back.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Limited - San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 3747 Midway Drive, San Diego, CA 92110
